column4: hello I have ubuntu 8.04. If I run an upgrade to say 10.04 will I lose my home folder, settings etc?
hello I have ubuntu 8.04. If I run an upgrade to say 10.04 will I lose my home folder, settings etc?
er um doesn't respect that setting?????
Ok I'll upgrade and be damned ha ha ha ha. Thanks.
Can anyone tell a quick way to solve this please: E: Malformed line 64 in source list /etc/apt/sources.list (dist parse)
I'm fairly sure there aren't 64 lines
E:Malformed line 64 in source list /etc/apt/sources.list (dist parse), E:The list of sources could not be read.'
you didn't put that line in your source list correctly... pastebin /etc/apt/sources.list
can y[ou not see the numbers on the side?
if i had to guess, its probably line 66... but thats just a guess...
you're gonna have a couple extra lines because of the way you copy/pasted that... so im' guessing its line 66
-so how do I disable them? # something is it?
honestly, i would just delete it.. rather than disable it.
there's no reason to comment it out, as its not in there properly as it is, so its useless
no, apt-get update, just updates your source list after you've made changes to it.. what exactly are you tryin to do?
& escott - thanks for your help bye
